intro: Trichilia lancei, commonly known as the African snowbell, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other economically important timber species. The plant is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and heart-shaped leaves that are often lobed. Its most distinctive feature is the bell-shaped white flowers that appear in clusters, giving it its common name. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
